newsitem.title: USA: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS - ends down 3/4 to one point.
newsitem.headline: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS - ends down 3/4 to one point.

text.p: U.S. municipal bond prices added to afternoon losses to end Thursday's session about 3/4 to one point lower, traders said.

A report from the National Association of Purchasing Management prompted much of the downturn. The association's index of manufacturing activity rose to 54.0 in December from 52.7 in November, indicating a strengthening economy.

Bids on Alliance Airport Authority, Texas, 6-3/8s of 2021 dropped one point from Tuesday's level, falling to 99-5/8. Yields jumped eight basis points on Florida Ports MBIA 5-3/8s of 2027, rising to 5.82 percent net.
The government market also dropped following release of the data, with the benchmark 30-year bond down 1-7/32 at 96-29/32 to yield 6.74 percent heading into the New York close.

In debt futures, the March municipal contract finished down 27/32 at 115-7/32. The March T-bond contract was down 1-8/32 at 111-12/32. The MOB spread was 123 ticks, widening from 110 at the close on Tuesday.
Next week's new issue calendar totals $2.2 billion in 78 offerings, according to Reuters Municipal Bond Information Group.
Competitive sales total $782 million in 51 issues. The largest is a $245.8 million two-part Washington general obligation deal on Tuesday.
Negotiated sales total $1.4 billion in 27 offerings. The largest is a $345.7 million Houston refunding deal through senior manager PaineWebber Inc.
